Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P1 (N-terminal fragment of Pilosulin 1, synthetic AMPs, UCLl1c, XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (47.83%) toCPF-AM4.  R: 15%; G: 20%; V=L: 15%. GRAVY: 0.81; M Wt: 2108.607; M formula: C97H170N30O22, mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against E. coli ML-35 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 4-8 uM), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. aureus 710A or MRSA (MIC 1.5-4 uM), and B. megaterium BM11 (MIC 2 uM). Also active against drug-resistant strains S. simulans 22 (MIC 2 uM), M. luteus (MIC 0.5 uM), Enterococcus spp (MIC 2 uM), S. haemolyticus I-10925 (MIC 2 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 2 uM), C. freundii I-11090 (MIC 2 uM), K. pneumoniae I-10910 (MIC 2 uM), S. maltophila O-16451 (MIC 2 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 4 uM or greater),Toxicity: 29% hemolysis at 10 uM and 100% hemolysis at 100 uM.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Zelezetsky I, Pag U, Antcheva N, Sahl HG, Tossi A.2005
Literature Information.Title: Identification and optimization of an antimicrobial peptide from the ant venom toxin pilosulin
